sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: More than 360 firefighters from Germany, Romania, Poland and Austria join in the battle against wildfires in southwestern France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Acclaimed author Salman Rushdie is on a ventilator and unable to speak after he was stabbed at an event in New York on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: As shelling continues near Europe's largest power plant, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky insists on Western travel bans for all Russian citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Taliban fighters unleash warning shots as a rare women's rights protest is staged in Afghanistan's capital city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A smouldering wasteland in the Gironde region of southwestern France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The massive blaze here and in the neighboring land has ravaged pine forests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: An area of more than 74 square kilometers has burned since Tuesday and led to the evacuation of at least 10,000 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Firefighters from across Europe have now joined in to help battle several wildfires, including in the southwest. These German firemen have been at work since Friday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We are proud to be here. All the colleagues are very keen to learn, to improve and of course to help the French firefighters in an efficient way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: More than 360 firefighters in specialized vehicles have arrived from Germany, Romania, Poland and Austria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They joined over 1,000 French firefighters already on site.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Without them, we wouldn't have had the resources committed here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We would have committed the resources to the detriment of other sectors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Yesterday as the foreign and French firefighters worked flat out, the fires in the region appeared contained.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But local authorities have warned that the ongoing blistering temperatures mean that victory is still uncertain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Streets turned into rivers in southern Italy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The aftermath of flash floods following violent thunderstorms on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The worst hit area was the coastal town of Silla. A combination of high seas and the rain has damaged the seafront promenade and destroyed bathing areas. And locals say rivers of mud washed cars and debris down the streets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I need my car to live and work. I'm in a situation where I've lost everything. I've lost everything.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This happens every year. It's not an episode.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It happens every year because the pipes are too tight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So what happens is that the manholes blow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Firefighters have been called out across the region to clear streets buried by mud, fallen trees and other debris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Authorities say the impact of landslides on the volcanic island of Stromboli were worse because of a recent fire which cleared all vegetation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Acclaimed author Salman Rushdie is on a ventilator and unable to speak after being attacked at

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: an event in the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The 75-year-old, who received death threats after writing his controversial book The Satanic Verses, was stabbed in the neck on Friday evening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Police raided the house of suspected attacker Hadi Mattar, a 24-year-old man from New Jersey who was arrested at the scene.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Detectives say they're still trying to establish a motive behind the attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I don't have any idea at this point.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Like I said, it's very early.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We don't have any indication of a motive at this time, but we are working with the FBI, the sheriff's office, and we will determine what the cause of this was or what the motive for this attack was.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Indian-born Rushdie has received praise and criticism for his work, which most notably includes his 1988 novel, which was considered blasphemous by some Muslims due to its references to the Prophet Muhammad. He has since become an advocate for freedom of speech and has defended his work on several occasions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At least 11 people have died after a shooting rampage in Montenegro. The incident happened on Friday afternoon local time when a 34-year-old man also shot two siblings with a hunting rifle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They were aged 8 and 11. Six other people were injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Montenegrin Prime Minister says that this is an inconceivable tragedy in Montenegro.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I'm asking citizens of Montenegro to keep the families of the killed in their thoughts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We are praying that all the injured ones, especially ones with bad injuries, survive and that everything ends well for them." It's understood that the family were staying in the shooter's house as tenants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Authorities say it's unclear what the motive was.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A three-day mourning period was declared in the country on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Living just kilometers from the Zaporozhye nuclear power station, the largest in Europe, residents of margonets in Ukraine say they're terrified about military bombardments in the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The UN warns continued shelling near the plant could, as they put it, lead to disaster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This resident says, we know the result of radiation and what might happen if something goes wrong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ksenia, a coffee shop vendor, adds, I'm scared for my parents and myself.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I want to live and enjoy life in this city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I wish this wasn't happening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's scary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky is doubling down on his calls for Western countries to enforce a travel ban for all Russian citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Speaking in his nightly address, Zelensky says, we need guarantees that Russian murderers and supporters of state terror won't use the Schengen area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's not acceptable to ruin the very idea of Europe and our common European values it's not possible to turn Europe into a supermarket where anyone can come in and pay for goods visa restrictions for Russian citizens are fair and all defenders of European values should insist on them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin's Russia already faces widespread sanctions from the West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But restrictions do not yet extend to a comprehensive travel ban.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This is the moment Taliban officials fired gunshots into the air to disperse a rare women's protest in Afghanistan's capital of Kabul.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Chanting bread, work and freedom, around 40 women marched in front of the education ministry on Saturday, just days before the Taliban marks its first year in power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Strict laws regulate women's rights in the country, with limits on their ability to work and have an education, as well as restrictions on travelling alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Some protesters were reportedly beaten by Taliban fighters who intervened to break up the demonstration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: FBI agents seized documents labelled as top secret from former US President Donald Trump's home as part of an investigation linked to the Espionage Act.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This newly published search warrant reveals that officials removed 11 sets of files from Trump's Mar-a-Lago seaside residence in Florida. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi says the retrieval of the documents represents a very serious situation. When we talk about this, there are laws against the improper handling of this material.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There are laws against that, and we have to recognize that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This information, as it is coming across, and we'll know more later, is highly classified, well above top secret.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: is highly classified well above top secret mr. Trump denies any wrongdoing and says the documents were declassified among the files was allegedly information about the president of France and an order pardoning Trump's long-standing ally Roger Stone removing classified documents is illegal under the US's Espionage Act and can carry a five-year prison sentence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Alarm bells are ringing in New York City as polio has been detected in wastewater

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: after it was thought to have been eradicated in the United States almost ten years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Health officials say it suggests the disease, which can be deadly, is already circulating locally. They've urged parents to ensure their children are vaccinated against polio, following similar advice in London this week, after the virus was also detected there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Polio was once one of the most feared diseases in the United States, with annual outbreaks causing thousands of cases of paralysis, mostly among children. From 1955, vaccines became available and annual cases in the US dropped, with the last recorded diagnosis in 2013.
